title: Project 3: Web Scraping and Visualization
text:
Overview
In this project, I scraped data from the web using Python and created visualizations to present insights.


Skills Demonstrated

Web Scraping
Data Cleaning
Data Visualization



Key Code Example

# Import Libraries
import requests
from bs4 import BeautifulSoup
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Scrape sample data
url = "https://example.com"
html_content = "<html><body><table><tr><th>Item</th><th>Value</th></tr><tr><td>Apples</td><td>10</td></tr><tr><td>Oranges</td><td>15</td></tr></table></body></html>"
soup = BeautifulSoup(html_content, "html.parser")

# Parse table into DataFrame
table = soup.find("table")
rows = table.find_all("tr")
data = []
for row in rows[1:]:
    cols = row.find_all("td")
    data.append([col.text for col in cols])

df = pd.DataFrame(data, columns=["Item", "Value"])
df["Value"] = df["Value"].astype(int)

# Show DataFrame
print(df)

# Visualization
plt.bar(df["Item"], df["Value"], color=["green", "orange"])
plt.title("Sample Scraped Data Visualization")
plt.xlabel("Item")
plt.ylabel("Value")
plt.grid(axis="y")
plt.show()

      Item  Value
0   Apples     10
1  Oranges     15

title: Project: SQL Integration Example
text:
ğŸ§  Overview
In this project, I demonstrate the use of SQL alongside Python using sqlite3 and pandas.
This integration allows for efficient data querying and analysis directly from relational databases.



ğŸ” Setup and SQL Queries
import sqlite3 import pandas as pd


Create an in-memory SQLite database
conn = sqlite3.connect(â€œ:memory:â€)


Create table
conn.execute(â€œâ€œâ€ CREATE TABLE players ( id INTEGER PRIMARY KEY, name TEXT, goals INTEGER, assists INTEGER ); â€œâ€œâ€œ)


Insert data
conn.executemany(â€œINSERT INTO players (name, goals, assists) VALUES (?, ?, ?);â€, [ (â€˜Aliceâ€™, 10, 3), (â€˜Bobâ€™, 7, 5), (â€˜Charlieâ€™, 2, 8)])


Query players with more than 5 goals
df = pd.read_sql_query(â€œSELECT * FROM players WHERE goals > 5;â€, conn) df

title: Project 2: Linear Regression Modeling
text:
Overview
In this project, I built and evaluated a Linear Regression model using Python and scikit-learn.


Skills Demonstrated

Predictive Modeling
Model Evaluation
Data Visualization



Key Code Example

# Import Libraries
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression

# Create sample data
np.random.seed(0)
X = 2 * np.random.rand(100, 1)
y = 4 + 3 * X + np.random.randn(100, 1)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict values
y_pred = model.predict(X)

# Model Coefficients
coef = model.coef_[0][0]
intercept = model.intercept_[0]
print("Coefficient:", coef)
print("Intercept:", intercept)

# Plot data and regression line
plt.scatter(X, y, color="blue", label="Data Points")
plt.plot(X, y_pred, color="red", linewidth=2, label="Regression Line")
plt.title("Linear Regression Fit")
plt.xlabel("X")
plt.ylabel("y")
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()

Coefficient: 2.968467510701018
Intercept: 4.222151077447232
